segment.source: You can manage and view details related to each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and configure services such as push notifications and Maps.
segment.target: You can manage and view details related to each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and configure services such as push notifications and Maps.

segment.source: App management and services
segment.target: App management and services

segment.source: App management and services
segment.target: App management and services

segment.source: You can manage and view details related to each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and configure services such as push notifications and Maps.
segment.target: You can manage and view details related to each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and configure services such as push notifications and Maps.

segment.source: When working with an app in your dashboard, you'll see sections in the left navigation menu for Services and App management.
segment.target: When working with an app in your dashboard, you'll see sections in the left navigation menu for Services and App management.

segment.source: You can expand these sections to access the functionality described below.
segment.target: You can expand these sections to access the functionality described below.

segment.source: Services
segment.target: Services

segment.source: The Services section lets you manage certain types of push notifications and map services.
segment.target: The Services section lets you manage certain types of push notifications and map services.

segment.source: Push notifications
segment.target: Push notifications

segment.source: Depending on your app's package type and its specific requirements, you can use one of the following options for push notifications:
segment.target: Depending on your app's package type and its specific requirements, you can use one of the following options for push notifications:

segment.source: Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) lets you send toast, tile, badge, and raw updates from your own cloud service.
segment.target: Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) lets you send toast, tile, badge, and raw updates from your own cloud service.

segment.source: For more info, see Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview.
segment.target: For more info, see Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview.

segment.source: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services lets you send push notifications, authenticate and manage app users, and store app data in the cloud.
segment.target: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services lets you send push notifications, authenticate and manage app users, and store app data in the cloud.

segment.source: For more info, see the Mobile Services documentation.
segment.target: For more info, see the Mobile Services documentation.

segment.source: Microsoft Push Notifications Service (MPNS) can be used with your .xap packages for Windows Phone.
segment.target: Microsoft Push Notifications Service (MPNS) can be used with your .xap packages for Windows Phone.

segment.source: You can send a limited number of unauthenticated notifications without doing any configuration here, although we recommend using authenticated notifications to avoid throttling limits.
segment.target: You can send a limited number of unauthenticated notifications without doing any configuration here, although we recommend using authenticated notifications to avoid throttling limits.

segment.source: If you're using MPNS, you'll need to upload a certificate to the field provided on the Push notifications page.
segment.target: If you're using MPNS, you'll need to upload a certificate to the field provided on the Push notifications page.

segment.source: For more info, see Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone 8.
segment.target: For more info, see Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone 8.

segment.source: Maps
segment.target: Maps

segment.source: To use map services in apps for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, you need a map service application ID and a token to include in your app's code.
segment.target: To use map services in apps for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, you need a map service application ID and a token to include in your app's code.

segment.source: You can get this token on the Maps page in the Services section.
segment.target: You can get this token on the Maps page in the Services section.

segment.source: Note To use map services in apps targeting other operating systems, visit the Bing Maps Dev Center.
segment.target: Note To use map services in apps targeting other operating systems, visit the Bing Maps Dev Center.

segment.source: See Request a maps authentication key for more info.
segment.target: See Request a maps authentication key for more info.

segment.source: For more info, see Use map services.
segment.target: For more info, see Use map services.

segment.source: Product collections and purchases
segment.target: Product collections and purchases

segment.source: To use the Windows Store collection API and the Windows Store purchase API to access ownership information for apps and IAPs, you need to enter the associated Azure AD client IDs here.
segment.target: To use the Windows Store collection API and the Windows Store purchase API to access ownership information for apps and IAPs, you need to enter the associated Azure AD client IDs here.

segment.source: Note that it may take up to 16 hours for these changes to take effect.
segment.target: Note that it may take up to 16 hours for these changes to take effect.

segment.source: For more info, see View and grant products from a service.
segment.target: For more info, see View and grant products from a service.

segment.source: App management
segment.target: App management

segment.source: The App management section lets you view identity and package details and manage your app's names.
segment.target: The App management section lets you view identity and package details and manage your app's names.

segment.source: App identity
segment.target: App identity

segment.source: This page shows you details related to your app's unique identity within the Store, including the URL(s) to link to your app's listing.
segment.target: This page shows you details related to your app's unique identity within the Store, including the URL(s) to link to your app's listing.

segment.source: For more info, see View app identity details.
segment.target: For more info, see View app identity details.

segment.source: Manage app names
segment.target: Manage app names

segment.source: This is where you can view all of the names that you've reserved for your app.
segment.target: This is where you can view all of the names that you've reserved for your app.

segment.source: You can reserve additional names here, or delete names you're no longer using.
segment.target: You can reserve additional names here, or delete names you're no longer using.

segment.source: For more info, see Manage app names.
segment.target: For more info, see Manage app names.

segment.source: Current packages
segment.target: Current packages

segment.source: This page lets you view details related to all of your published packages.
segment.target: This page lets you view details related to all of your published packages.

segment.source: Note You won't see any info here until after your app has been published.
segment.target: Note You won't see any info here until after your app has been published.

segment.source: The name, version, and architecture of each package is shown.
segment.target: The name, version, and architecture of each package is shown.

segment.source: Click Details to show additional info such as supported language, app capabilities, and file sizes.
segment.target: Click Details to show additional info such as supported language, app capabilities, and file sizes.

segment.source: The exact info you see for each package may differ depending on its targeted operating system and other factors.
segment.target: The exact info you see for each package may differ depending on its targeted operating system and other factors.

segment.source: For example, if you've added Windows ad mediation into your package, you'll find a link to configure mediation for that package here.
segment.target: For example, if you've added Windows ad mediation into your package, you'll find a link to configure mediation for that package here.

segment.source: Developers with OEM permissions can also generate preinstall packages from the Current packages page.
segment.target: Developers with OEM permissions can also generate preinstall packages from the Current packages page.
